contents.item: According to Hugh Thomas, author of 'A History of the World', the greatest medical advance in history has been garbage collection. The greatest psychological advance in history is just around the corner and will also have to do with cleaning up. Cleaning up lies and "coming out of the closet" is getting more attention these days. Some day we will look back on these years of suffocation in bullsh*t in the same way we look back on all the years people lived in, and died from, their garbage.
contents.owner: Brad Blanton, Radical Honesty : How to Transform Your Life by Telling the Truth

contents.item: The less you feed the ego, the stronger you will be.
contents.owner: Aleksandra Ninkovic, Write like no one is reading

contents.item: Somebody becomes an enemy if you personalize the unconsciousness that is the ego. Non-reaction is not weakness but strength. Another word for non-reaction is forgiveness. To forgive is to overlook, or rather to look through. You look through the ego to the sanity that is in every human being as his or her essence.
contents.owner: Eckhart Tolle, A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose

contents.item: If we seek spiritual heroism ourselves, the old ego is just back in control under a new name. There would not really be any change at all, but only disguise, just bogus self-improvement on our own terms.
contents.owner: Richard Rohr, Falling Upward: A Spirituality for the Two Halves of Life

contents.item: A touch less ego and dash more humility will improve the quality of anything you turn your hand to.
contents.owner: Rasheed Ogunlaru

contents.item: Imagination paints a charming view of the future, conveniently adapted to the demands of our current emotion.
contents.owner: John Armstrong, Conditions of Love: The Philosophy of Intimacy

contents.item: The Ego is a veil between humans and God’.”“In prayer all are equal.
contents.owner: Jalaluddin Rumi

contents.item: If I am indeed my own god, I’d better start praying to myself to get myself out of myself.
contents.owner: Craig D. Lounsbrough

contents.item: O, how easy it is to do religious things if other people are watching! Preaching, praying, attending church, reading the bible, acts of kindness and charity-they all take on a certain pleasantness of the ego if we know that others will find out about them and think well of us. It is a deadly addiction for esteem that we have.
contents.owner: John Piper, A Hunger for God

contents.item: If we want to live perfectly happy lives...we must drive out selfish character tendencies such as pride, ego, vanity, jealousy, lusts, envy and worry. When we learn to live selflessly, putting others before ourselves, committing to what is noble, right and good; treating others with love and compassion...that's when true happiness is experienced. A genuine focus on selflessness cures all and creates an environment for true growth. It's the secret to every great relationship. We gain...when we give up self. Sacrificing one's selfish characteristics through diligent thought, meditation, prayer and action gives life to true love and abounding joy.~Jason Versey
contents.owner: Jason Versey, A Walk with Prudence

contents.item: We all need to humble ourselves from time to time and expose ourselves to new perspectives and ideas, even those of the non-experts, or else our growth potential gets weighed down with the ignorance of ego and habit.
contents.owner: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar

contents.item: Please, not again what you studied, how long you spent at it, how many books you wrote, what people thought of you - but: what did you learn?
contents.owner: Idries Shah, Reflections

contents.item: Nobody can say anything about you. Whatsoever people say is about themselves. But you become very shaky, because you are still clinging to a false center. That false center depends on others, so you are always looking to what people are saying about you. And you are always following other people, you are always trying to satisfy them. You are always trying to be respectable, you are always trying to decorate your ego. This is suicidal. Rather than being disturbed by what others say, you should start looking inside yourself…Whenever you are self-conscious you are simply showing that you are not conscious of the self at all. You don’t know who you are. If you had known, then there would have been no problem— then you are not seeking opinions. Then you are not worried what others say about you— it is irrelevant!When you are self-conscious you are in trouble. When you are self-conscious you are really showing symptoms that you don’t know who you are. Your very self-consciousness indicates that you have not come home yet.
contents.owner: Osho

contents.item: There is a place where there is freedom of fear and doubt, and that is within.
contents.owner: Michelle Cruz-Rosado

contents.item: I do not belong to any spiritual group or tradition. I am just interested in exploring what it means to live with open eyes. People in spiritual organizations also tend to get caught in ideas of how it should be, and in the need of the ego to create hierachies of power, status, roles, ambition and obidience.Spiritual Masters teach on many different levels at the same time. Some people take what they can, and some take something deeper.
contents.owner: Swami Dhyan Giten

contents.item: The human Soul will only find its Light,when the Ego gives its permission.
contents.owner: C.C. Campbell, The Stolen Light of Women: A Quest for Spiritual Truth Beyond Religion

contents.item: Presenting a humble façade gains trust; flattery appeals to ego; combine the two to gain an ego-based trust within someone, and you will find in your hands a judgement clouding tool second only to love.
contents.owner: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar

contents.item: The true instrument is that, with the help of which, the egoism and my-ness goes away.
contents.owner: Dada Bhagwan

contents.item: If one has egoism without my-ness, he will go to moksha; all this entrapment is there because of egoism with my-ness!
contents.owner: Dada Bhagwan

contents.item: Gnani Purush’ (the enlightened one) is considered to be the owner of the whole universe. And yet, there is not the slightest egoism in Him. Where there is no authority, there is egoism and where there is authority, there is no egoism. This is the wonder of ‘Gnani Purush!’ ‘Gnani Purush’ is the manifest light.
contents.owner: Dada Bhagwan
